intro: Steffensia elongata, commonly known as the elongated steffensia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, aromatic scent. Steffensia elongata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
